subject: Programming
title: Cloud Computing and Serverless
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Cloud Computing and Serverless.

hook.text: Why buy servers when you can rent computing by the second from a global provider?

buildup.text: AWS launched in 2006, letting startups access the same infrastructure as Fortune 500 companies.

discovery.text: Serverless goes further: write a function, upload it, and the cloud handles scaling automatically.

twist.text: Cloud costs can spiral out of control. Companies discover their 'cheap' cloud bill is millions per year.

climax.text: Cloud democratized infrastructure. Anyone with a credit card can build at global scale.

punchline.text: Rent the computing. Own the product.

quiz.question: What did AWS democratize starting in 2006?
